title: Inconsistent array types between PoFileParser and Package lead to TypeError
body:
This is a (multiple allowed):

* [x] bug
* [ ] enhancement
* [ ] feature-discussion (RFC)

* CakePHP Version: 4.2.0
* Platform and Target: PHP 7.4.5, IntegrationTestTrait, PhpUnit 9.4.2

### What you did
Upgraded from cakephp 4.1 to 4.2. Ran one of my integration tests that calls an API endpoint that throws an exception

### What happened
error500.php tries to render. it therefore tries to fetch some message from the PO file which fails with a type error

```
2020-12-21 17:46:00.669 Error: [TypeError] Argument 2 passed to Cake\I18n\Package::addMessage() must be of the type string, array given, called in /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/I18n/Translator.php on line 98 in /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/I18n/Package.php on line 85
Stack Trace:
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/I18n/Translator.php:98
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/I18n/Translator.php:123
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/I18n/functions.php:98
- /var/www/templates/Error/error500.php:41
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/View/View.php:1176
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/View/View.php:1134
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/View/View.php:764
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Error/ExceptionRenderer.php:438
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Error/ExceptionRenderer.php:416
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Error/ExceptionRenderer.php:407
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Error/ExceptionRenderer.php:281
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Error/Middleware/ErrorHandlerMiddleware.php:143
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Error/Middleware/ErrorHandlerMiddleware.php:125
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Http/Runner.php:73
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Http/Runner.php:58
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Http/Server.php:90
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/TestSuite/MiddlewareDispatcher.php:142
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/TestSuite/IntegrationTestTrait.php:470
- /var/www/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/TestSuite/IntegrationTestTrait.php:356
- /var/www/plugins/Rest/tests/TestCase/Controller/MyControllerTestControllerTest.php:131
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestCase.php:1536
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestCase.php:1142
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestResult.php:730
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestCase.php:883
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestSuite.php:669
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestSuite.php:669
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestSuite.php:669
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/TextUI/TestRunner.php:673
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/TextUI/Command.php:148
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/TextUI/Command.php:101
- /var/www/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/phpunit:61


```
### What you expected to happen
standard 500 error page being rendered

### Investigations
CakePHPs `PoFileParser::parse` returns a complex array structure. `MessagesFileLoader:142` takes this complex, multi-dimensional array structure and calls `$package->setMessages($messages)` with it. The later expects a much simpler `string[]`. Because of PHPs lack of strict array types, this error propagates: the bad typed messages array is persisted in Package::$messages, which causes `Package::getMessage($key)` to return the wrong type (`array` instead of `string`) when being called by the `Translator::getMessage(string $key)`. This all works fine until `Translator::getMessage(string $key)` tries to call `$this->package->addMessage($key, $message)` which expects parameter 2 to be a string, but an array is provided.
